docs.lead_paragraph: Pregnant or sick and without health coverage? Well, you can always hold a fundraiser and get the strippers to work for no charge. Once again "Friday Night Lights" poignantly got at the hardships experienced by the more troubled sector of the two Americas. Mindy's early contractions signaled complications with her pregnancy and Billy does not have any insurance. To even keep her safely in the hospital for a night -- she's got to go on bed rest -- is going to be a huge struggle for him financially. But Mindy's stripper friends rally together to offer their services for free to raise money for her treatment. It is moments like these that give "Friday Night Lights'' the tempered levity that keeps it from being relentlessly melodramatic. Terrible things keep happening to people, but there are always displays of resilience and wherewithal.

headline.main: 'Friday Night Lights' Watch: Of Tragedy and Resiliency

docs.abstract: "Friday Night Lights'' just never lets up on the selfish dads, and this episode felt like a very subversive Father's Day special.
docs.snippet: "Friday Night Lights'' just never lets up on the selfish dads, and this episode felt like a very subversive Father's Day special.

docs.lead_paragraph: What makes a father? That is the question I asked in a post earlier today, and it is one that Douglas L., a management consultant in Pennsylvania, has been asking for several months now. He is a father. He became one last October when his daughter was born. The baby's mother was a woman with whom he had what he describes as a "casual" relationship.
docs.abstract: A father struggles to define his role after having a daughter with woman who no longer wants his presence in their lives.
docs.snippet: A father struggles to define his role after having a daughter with woman who no longer wants his presence in their lives.
